{"step_by_step_thinking": "Folic acid deficiency can be caused by inadequate dietary intake, impaired absorption, increased requirements, and pharmacologic interactions. Among the given options, phenytoin is known to antagonize folate utilization and inhibit its absorption, leading to folate deficiency. Aspirin, ranitidine, and cyclosporin are not known to directly precipitate folic acid deficiency.", "answer_choice": "D"}
